channel.title: Building a new PC, need suggestions
channel.description:
so am building a new PC for both Gaming and Designing but I want to be around 700-900$
so what I EXACTLY need is this:
1-6Gb DD2 Ram 2-500GB hard Disk 3-1GB Nividia Card 4-a good sound card 5-a good motherboard with a power supply
suggestions would be really appreciated

item.title: Building a new PC, need suggestions
item.dc:creator: DeleteThis
item.description:
Just a Black Mesa G-Man.:

Well, Mr. Shadi, I only know a few good computers, but they’re over $900. They’re very useful though. Here’s on of my favorites that I’m going to buy in a year:

HP TouchSmart Desktop PC with Intel Core i7-720QM Processor, 23" Touch-enabled Full 1080p HD LCD Monitor, Windows 7 Home Premium 64-Bit
Intel Core i7-720QM processor
6GB memory & 1TB hard drive
23" touchpanel display
Webcam, 6-in-1 card reader, Wi-Fi
Windows 7 Home Premium

Can you make your signature smaller?

item.source: Building a new PC, need suggestions

item.title: Building a new PC, need suggestions
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

Raid is the absolute wrong thing to do. In the worst case it would be slower than without it. But I recommend to buy one faster and smaller harddisk and one bigger but slower disk for use as storage.

For me RAID 0 is clearly faster than a single harddrive, most noticeably shorter loading times in video games and the speed at which large files can be copied (my write speeds literally doubled) on a harddrive. Some people will argue differentely about it, in theory it should be much faster but I guess it depends on what you’re doing. Reading reviews would be the best way to go.

Read full topic

item.source: Building a new PC, need suggestions

item.title: Building a new PC, need suggestions
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
Shadi:

guys do you recommend this card for me ?

https://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/searchtools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=5599121&pagenumber=2&RSort=1&csid=ITD&recordsPerPage=5&body=#ReviewStart

so this is what I’ve chosen so far, watcha think guys ?
https://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=6295370&Sku=B69-1202

The CPU is good, you could overclock that stable to 3.6 GHz with a slightly increased voltage. I suggest you go for DDR-3 (PC3-10600) memory though, 1333 MHz should be enough for the CPU running at 3.8 GHz, at this frequency make sure you get decent timings ( 8-8-8 ).
For improved harddisk speed get two HDD’s of smaller size then put them in a RAID 0 array (so 2x350 GB would be 700 GB total with double performance, striped data 128k - setting up RAID is explained in mobo manual )
Make sure you have ways to back-up your system because if one drive fails you lose all files.

For DDR-3 memory you’d have to pick a different motherboard, if this is not within your price range then stick with DDR-2. Make sure to pick memory which is listed on the QVL (qualified vendor list) for the motherboard, otherwise stability of the system might be in danger.
The powersupply (750 watt) is overkill, 600 watt with 80% effeciency (minimum) should be enough unless you plan on going SLI.

edit:

When picking a motherboard, make sure it supports overclocking in some way. Getting a Q9550 and not overclocking it is pointless. (why run at 2.8 GHz when you could run at 3.6 GHz 24/7?)

edit 2:

Also before I forget, make sure you get a custom cooler for the CPU incase you’re overclocking, a Zalman CNPS 9700 will keep it cool but it’s on the expensive side. Try looking up some reviews of cheaper models and see whichones best. This cooler will fit in a small tower, unless you got a 120mm+ fan on the side panel.

Read full topic
